Abstract
In this paper, we consider a transformation of kğ‘˜k disjoint paths in a graph. For a graph and a pair of kğ‘˜k disjoint paths ğ’«ğ’«\mathcal{P} and ğ’¬ğ’¬\mathcal{Q} connecting the same set of terminal pairs, we aim to determine whether ğ’«ğ’«\mathcal{P} can be transformed to ğ’¬ğ’¬\mathcal{Q} by repeatedly replacing one path with another path so that the intermediates are also kğ‘˜k disjoint paths. The problem is called Disjoint Paths Reconfiguration. We first show that Disjoint Paths Reconfiguration is ğ–¯ğ–²ğ–¯ğ– ğ–¢ğ–¤ğ–¯ğ–²ğ–¯ğ– ğ–¢ğ–¤\mathsf{PSPACE}-complete even when k=2ğ‘˜2k=2.
